data.label: ATI TV Wonder Elite PCI Remote Control Edition 100-703205
data.description: Get a high-end home theater system with the flexibility and advanced features only a PC can offer with ATI's TV Wonder Elite. ATI's TV Wonder Elite introduces a new era of digital entertainment capabilities to your PC, incorporating ATI's advanced video processing technology found inside many of today's top television displays and home theater components.

Reviews.title: The bundled software really sucks
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2007
Reviews.text:
The controls for changing channel, volume, date & time etc all require you to click up or down. There's no way to enter the desired value directly. For example, if the channel is set to 2 and you want 60, you have to click thru all 58 channels. This makes setting recording times very tedious.

If the included TV programming guide software is used to program a show to record, it wipes out all of the manually programmed times. Also, the guide sometimes fails to record the requested program.

The driver for the remote control crashes rending the remote non-function. This happens even when the remote is not in use.

After installing the TV card, I've found that sometimes the video will not come back on after the Windows power save turns it off. I ended up disabling power save. Also after installing, I began having problems with my computer shutting itself off.

Reviews.title: GOOD TV TUNER
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2007
Reviews.text:
I purchased this TV card primarily for watching TV and recording TV programs. I already read other reviews in Amazon, and I know that there were some problems with the Cybercinema software included in the package. It is OK for watching TV or listen to FM Radio, but it did not work for capturing video from analog sources such VHS tapes or camcorders. So I got the GBPVR software which is free and works great. Also I use Virtualdub for capturing video from analog sources with your favorite video codec.

The TV tuner, itself, works great. The recordings have very good quality and watching TV is a pleasure.

Reviews.title: Slow, Slow, Slow!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2007
Reviews.text:
Pros: The picture quality is nice

Cons: There is a two second delay, so channel surfing is NOT an option. The product does not come with viewing software. The remote does not tune cable boxes. Plug-ins for the remote software are user-derived and filled with glitches.

Reviews.title: Terrific card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2007
Reviews.text:
The ATI TV Wonder Elite is simply the best card I've tried, and I've tried a few.

My only complaint is the bundled software is worthless. Install only the controllers needed for the remote off the CD, and get SnapStream's BeyondTV (google it) to use with the card. This combination is incredibly powerful -- ATI's got the best card, and SnapStream's got the best software for it. I look forward to a HD-capable card that can accept more than over-the-air signals.

Shows recorded with this card and burned to DVD (which can be done within BeyondTV) are professional quality.

Reviews.title: Not compatible with many systems
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 27, 2006
Reviews.text: Warning: this card does NOT support Media Center in recent Dell Dimension PCs. Sonic CinePlayer will not function after installing the ATI drivers. The card does not work with Roxio Creator MyDVD. Neither ATI tech support nor Dell support can offer fixes for these incompatibilities. If you are lucky enough to have a compatible system, this card may produce great video. But beware, the driver software may not work in your system.

Reviews.title: Not bad but not the greatest
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 19, 2006
Reviews.text: Very hard to use with direcTV since you have to have the reciever box in order to change channels. volume is really low when you watch tv so you have to turn it up really loud and scares the hell out of me when I get an instant message cause its soo loud. The video quality is average its not sharp and crisp. Also has a really slow reaction speed. When i control the DirecTV reciever it takes about 3-4 seconds for it to show on screen which at times is very annoying. The recording quality is so so when i watched a playback there were horizontal lines everywhere and was a little bit blurry. And on DirecTV you cant choose shows that you want to record becuase you have to set it to the channel the show is on and then set the time you want it to record because you can't control the channels from your computer. You basically set it on channel 3 then set the channel on the reciever. As for the software, cant even use guide plus becuase its not cable.

Reviews.title: DOESN'T WORK WITH SATILITE TV
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 18, 2006
Reviews.text:
If you have a satellite dish and a Dolby digital surround sound card, the ATI card doesn't work very well. You have to use the composite signal input, not the tuner input. The tuner portion of this card is for ANALOG SIGNAL ONLY. In order to watch your satellite TV thru the composite signal in, you have to download ATI's Multimedia version 9.13.

Now you can watch Satellite TV, but ATI's Multimedia version 9.13

doesn't recognize a Dolby digital surround sound card. You have to us the RCA right and left stereo inputs from your Satellite Box.

Even after all that the ATI card doesn't work that well, the response is very slow.

data.description: The new ultimate is here with the ZOTAC GAMING GeForce RTX 3090 Ti Series. Focused with function over form, the top-tier AMP Extreme Holo is equipped with the award-winning HoloBlack design and the most powerful IceStorm cooling system from ZOTAC. FEATURES • HoloBlack Design • SPECTRA 2.0 RGB Lighting • IceStorm 2.0 Advanced Cooling • Active Fan Control with FREEZE Fan Stop • Dual BIOS • Metal RGB LED Backplate • GDDR6X Graphics Memory • 2nd Gen Ray Tracing Cores, 3rd Gen Tensor Cores • VR Ready, NVIDIA DLSS, NVIDIA NVLink (SLI-ready) • NVIDIA G-SYNC, NVIDIA GPU Boost SPECIFICATIONS • NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 Ti GPU • 10752 CUDA cores • 24GB GDDR6X memory • 384-bit memory bus • Engine boost clock: 1890 MHz • Memory clock: 21 Gbps • PCI Express 4.0 16x SOFTWARE COMPATIBILITY • Game Ready Drivers and NVIDIA Studio Drivers • Microsoft DirectX 12 Ultimate, Vulkan RT API • OpenGL 4.6 • Windows 11 / 10 (64-bit) POWER REQUIREMENTS • 850-watt PSU recommended • 450-watt max consumption • PCIe 5.0 12+4-pin power CONNECTIONS • 3 x DisplayPort 1.4a (up to 7680x4320@60Hz) • 1 x HDMI Connector • HDCP 2.3 support • Quad simultaneous display capable.

Reviews.title: Nvidia good, zotac par
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 5, 2022
Reviews.text:
As far as the GPU chip itself, it's monstrously powerful but not economical (no surprise).

The zotac software has issues with its RGB lighting and the fans on the shroud are subpar. I actually took off the shroud and am cooling it with two large case fans and hitting better temperature marks at less noise.
To be fair, I have also done some tweaking in afterburner. Mostly lowering the voltage has had probably a bigger impact as three power cables are certainly overkill.

While i opened the amazon box i noticed the gpu box seal was broken, so i only got an empty box with nothing inside... so someone from their packaging area stole it. Got refund but now i couldnt order it again since they have a buying limit and they counted that as me buying it...

Reviews.title: A Great Graphics Card, as long as it's on sale.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 30, 2022
Reviews.text:
With the new RTX 4090 releasing soon for $1,600+, these 3090 TIs are a great alternative as long aa you can get them on sale for around $1,000-$1,200. You'll be getting about the same performance as the 16gb 4080 that should release in November for less than the same price of around $1,200.
Just make sure that you have a Power Supply rated for 1,000w at minimum as these Zotac cards can pull 500+ watts at heavy load.

Reviews.title: Worth it for me but not for most people.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 28, 2022
Reviews.text: I've owned it for about a month now and I have no complaints from a performance standpoint. It was expensive and frankly overpriced but I play flight simulators like DCS World and MSFS 2020 on high settings and vr and those type of games require the best of the best to get everything to run smooth, I have a flight sim cockpit I have built so it has a bunch of display monitors and dozens of applications running in sync with one another, for me, it was the only viable option for my standards. The fan sound is loud if running full blast but I typically wear headphones anyways. One thing does bother me, there is something weird that I believe to be a bug in the drivers (this is a problem with other new nvidia cards so I don't think it's Zotacs fault) where if I don't turn the power settings in Nvidia control panel to Optimal instead of Prefer maximum performance AND run MSI afterburner all the time then my computer idles at 50 to 60c which is nuts. As soon as i turn on msi afterburner it goes back down to 29c. This is a ugly bug that Nvidia needs to figure out and causes my card to throttle all the way up to 1800 mhz just doing nothing. Didn't ever have this issue with my 2080 super. This card is for a niche crowd only and can't recommend unless you got some passionate hobby that really drives you to buy one, so if you really need good stable frames for something like flight simming and already have a great computer it's ok.

Reviews.title: It's good, but has some
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2022
Reviews.text: It works great overall! It does everything I need it to do rn. However, my case didn't seem to support the extra LED support stand without having it touch the fans on the card. It has its issues that can be resolved. But it's nice that it's well made enough to not need a support cable.

Reviews.title: Rolled the Dice on a Zotac Card and..
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on April 24, 2022
Reviews.text:
Lost. Most of the complaints I've read about Zotac have to do with the fans failing. I figured if that happened, I would frankenstein it or RMA. No big deal.. I got it set up and plugged in to 2 Display Port monitors and 1 HDMI 2.1 LG OLED. Within an hour of running benchmarks and drooling over RDR2 4K 120hz goodness, I lost the hdmi connection. Only way it would come back is if I unplugged a Display Port cable. Not great, but I started doing research to see if it was something on my end. Rebooted my computer into safe mode, ran DDU, fresh driver install, made sure I was using the Nvidia 'PC' resolution option in the settings menu etc. and then I lost another Display Port connection.

So only 1 Display Port would work at a time, and the HDMI 2.1 was dead. Outside of this glaring issue, the card ran cool and performed amazing in games and benchmarks. Fans were a little loud but not obnoxious if kept below 70% and I would have happily kept the card if the outputs worked.

I did read some posts saying fans don't work in some models of zotac, but mine works fine and definitely turns on when playing a game. It also comes with an LED support bar.

data.label: MSI Gaming GeForce RTX 3090 Ti 24GB GDRR6X 384-Bit HDMI/DP Nvlink Tri-Frozr Ampere Architecture OC Graphics Card (RTX 3090 Ti SUPRIM X 24G)
data.description: The GeForce RTX 3090 Ti is a big ferocious GPU (BFGPU) with TITAN class performance. It's powered by Ampere—NVIDIA's 2nd gen RTX architecture—doubling down on ray tracing and AI performance with enhanced RT Cores, Tensor Cores, and new streaming multiprocessors. Plus, it features a staggering 24 GB of G6X memory, all to deliver the ultimate gaming experience.

Reviews.title: Great Card and well built
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 28, 2022
Reviews.text:
Pros:
Can handle 1440p 165hz easily with max setting majority of games
Cooling is well handled when gaming, hovers around 70-72 in most games in a corsair 4000d with a nhd15 cooler
Comes with a anti sag bracket to support the card
24 vrm phase plus 4 phase for memory
Dual bios switch (Silent and Gaming mode only changes fan curves)

Cons:
Massive card, around 13 inches so almost a tight fit with my corsair 4000d
MSI center is sort of pain at times trying to control RGB, wish there was a switch like on the older strix cards so you can disable rgb
No manual power adjustment as in its capped at 480w no higher unlike the Strix/Gaming OC/FTW3 utlra (This is just my opinion though)

Overall the card is amazing. It's much better than my 3090 which I gave to a friend while upgrade to the 90ti. The 3090 would usually hit 80c most of the time and run hot due to the back VRAM, but the 90ti removes the back VRAM and uses 2gb modules, which runs cooler and a little bit better. Been getting around a 5-15% boost in frames over the 90 as well. If you already have a 90/80ti/80 its not worth upgrading unless you want to. Card should hold out till the 4090 or the 4090 ti recieves a price cut at its end of life cycle or when the 50 series launches in the future for me.

Reviews.title: Absolutely amazing!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 29, 2022
Reviews.text: After waiting for what seemed like forever I finally was able to have choices available to me for gpus, knowing what the 40 series was going to offer and the ridiculous price they are going to cost I could not pass up a great deal on this card, imo one of the best if not the best 3090 ti models, still a 5-8 year card, runs everything I play at 4k 100hz + no problem. I have a gigabyte 32in curved 4k 144 (oc160hz) gaming monitor looks stunning, coming from a rog strix 2070 super its quite the upgrade. As far as power supplies go I would recommend at least a 1000w, I'm running a be quiet dark power 12 1000w and it runs flawlessly, in a corsair 5000x rgb case plenty of room and lots of air flow are a must for this card. My second gaming rig coming from consoles, I am completely blown away by the performance. Also runs VR perfectly, everything in Ultra. So happy with this build and card.

Reviews.title: Amazing 1440P Gaming Card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 27, 2022
Reviews.text: I had been wanting to upgrade my GPU for a while now but couldn’t due to the insane pricing that lasted for so long. Finally managed to grab this Gigabyte Gaming OC 3070 TI for 649.99. I upgraded to a 3070 ti from a 2070 Super and the performance gain was massive. I gained nearly 30-40 FPS in every single game. I play everything from new AAA titles to MMOs like WoW Classic to indie games. Dying Light 2, Witcher 3, Cyberpunk 2077, etc. I can play these new AAA games at Ultra Settings 1440P with Raytracing and still get normally well over 100 fps. Stuff like indie games, E-Sports games, MMOs like WoW/FF14 I can play Ultra 1440P and hit my monitors max refresh rate of 165 fps at all times. It’s amazing. I included pictures of the GPU in and out of my system. It’s a pretty beefy card. Make sure your case has room. It’s a 3x slot design with 3x fans and a back plate. There is some subtle RGB lighting on the card which you can adjust to your liking. The card itself I can’t ever hear. I have mine overclocked +500mhz memory clock and +100mhz core clock. My core clock runs at 2070mhz and memory clock at 10,000mhz and my GPU never passes 64-65C under full load. All this while being silent using auto mode fan speeds which never pass 70% speed. The GPU is quite, powerful, looks good, and doesn’t sag when installed. Amazing card IMO especially for 650 US dollars. When overclocked you get very close to the performance of an RTX 3080 for significantly less money. I have this GPU paired with a Ryzen 7 5800X, and 32GB(4x8GB) of 3600mhz CL16 memory. On an Asus X570 Prime - Pro Motherboard all powered by a Seasonic Focus 80+ Gold 850 Watt Power Supply. As a whole the system runs like a dream. Anything I wanna play at 1440P Ultra settings I can well over 100 fps. If someone had a 4K monitor they could easily game at 4k on this GPU provided they have a good CPU to match its power. So far not had a single issues with this card. Of all the 3070 ti models it’s considered an A tier model. With some of the best components, VRMs, overclocking, cooling, and power limits. If you can get this GPU for 700 or under its well worth it IMO. Check out the pics and thanks for reading. EDIT - Reading other reviews I notice several people complain about the software and RGB on the card. For me personally I have had no issue with either. The lighting looks great, has worked flawlessly since install and took me two mins to set up. The software while not amazing takes a couple mins to install. Once I installed it and matches the RGB lighting on my GPU to the color profile of everything else I hit save and that’s literally it. I’ve never had to touch or open the Software ever again. Used it one time for two mins that’s it. If I wanted to change the pattern, lighting, color, etc of the GPU I easily can. As you can see in the pics I run a blue/black theme setup and I basically leave it at that. If your someone who constantly changes the lighting and colors in your system maybe the software might have some issues idk. For what little time I used it to setup my lighting it worked perfectly and has kept my profile saved without me ever have opening or used it since. You can even make it so the lighting is one way/color when the system is on and a different way/color when the system is off. Reviews.title: Install card and download latest drive and you'll love this card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2022

I downloaded the latest drivers for this card, and everything worked except the Display ports. This is not an issue with the card but the software in windows and the Nvidia firmware not cooperating. Install the Nvidia experience and use the setup utility to set up multiple displays and the display ports should begin working. One last note; I use DisplayPort to HDMI adapters and some brands have not worked for me. I normally will not promote product brands but seeing the number of people that have had trouble finding a good adapter for Nvidia based cards, I will say I have had a lot of success with Starware brand adapters when others did not work.

Reviews.title: Great GPU, stop complaining about the price.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2022
Reviews.text:
Everyone who leaves a review about how expensive this GPU is. The fact that it's less than 500 USD when I bought it makes me happy. It wasn't that long ago something comparable would have been over 1000 USD. If you don't like the price, don't buy it, and if you buy it anyway, don't be one of those people that complains about how expensive it is.

It was a huge step up from the 1030 2GB GPU I had in my computer. I was over clocking just to get it to run games on the lowest settings, now I have my computer in eco mode running my most graphics demanding games on Ultra settings. My download speeds have improved, the image quality is infinitely better, rendering distances are better, frame rates went up, refresh rate went up. It's made a huge difference in my gaming. I'm finally excited to game on my PC because I know it can handle the games I want to play.

It works great with my dual monitor setup. Make sure that your monitors have the right connectors, it only has one HDMI port. So you'll need an adapter or have at least one monitor with the right connector on it if you're running dual monitor. It can theoretically handle 4 monitors at once, but I don't see a need for it with my setup.

data.description: The latest iteration of MSI’s iconic GAMING series once again brings performance, low-noise efficiency, and aesthetics that hardcore gamers have come to recognize and trust. Now you too can enjoy all your favorite games with a powerful graphics card that stays cool and silent. Just the way you like it. It's built with enhanced RT Cores and Tensor Cores, new streaming multiprocessors, and superfast G6X memory for an amazing gaming experience.

Reviews.title: Fan Noise is LOW - This is the card to get.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 26, 2022
Reviews.text:
My personal philosophy with modern GPU's is that your silicon lottery is going to be way more of an influence than whatever factory overclock setup an Add-In board manufacturer like MSI is going to do. That's all just gravy.

What's important then, is the looks, the price, and the NOISE. That comes in two forms: Fan noise, and coil whine.

Now I'm not an industry expert on who has more coil whine in general among the brands. I have heard MSI is on the low side, and I have a 980ti that never had any coil whine, to the point where I didn't know what it was until I bought a 1080ti from Asus and it had a TON.

This 3080ti I have from MSI does have some moderate coil whine, but it's the good kind. You are probably going to get some from any GPU of this power, completely normal. This is low, and not at frequencies that are bothersome. It makes you really know when she's working hard.

Now on to the part MSI has some control over: The fan noise. Lack-there-of. Really quiet even at full load, but I normally have the fans turned down really low, 30-35%. Just enough to keep them spinning. But the important part that MSI did do correctly that makes that possible is how good the fans and the cooler are. This thing stays cool even at very low fan speeds, allowing you to cut down on noise.

It pumps, it looks great, and I got it when prices dropped, so if you want a 3080ti - Highly Recommend.

Reviews.title: Great performer with lots of overclocking overhead
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 17, 2022

Reviews.title: Massive Card
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2022
Reviews.text:
Like the title says, this card is quite large, but that actually serves as a benefit since the heat sink is large as well. In terms of performance, this card is a monster. I can play Cyberpunk 2077 at 1440p and Max settings at around 100fps with DLSS on, and around 85 without dlss.

One thing to note about this card. Unless you tweak the fan curve, it can get quite warm. Other cards I’ve owned generally stabilize under load at around 70-75 Celsius, but this one quickly jumps up to 80-82 celsius when under heavy load. However, the cooler is powerful enough to cool it back down to the seventies if you just increase the fans’ RPM in MSI afterburner or vbios.

Overall, I love this card, and the fact that I got for almost $200 off of MSRP is just cherry on the cake.

Reviews.title: Its a GPU you can buy.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 17, 2022
Reviews.text:
For the price at this point in the products life youre probably better off waiting till the msrp drops before the 4000 series drops. However if youre upgrading today and need a card or don't want to deal with the potiential nuclear power plant youll need to power the 4000 series than maybe this is a hood deal.

It needs 750 to 850 watts depending on your system spec. And it requires 3 8pin. Its also a monster in size. If you have a water block or a drove cage be aware this thing isn't going to play nice.

The included support bracket is great. I was concerned with airflow issues but Ive got dual front fans blowing in from the front and out the back passively. So far ive seen no over heating. Case is a Fractal Design Define r6 mid tower with the drive cage removed.

Reviews.title: Faster than a Cheetah but needs the power of a Gorilla!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 23, 2022
Reviews.text:
Be sure to check the specifications needed for this beast!

Recommended PSU Wattage
750 - 1000

Will require to have atleast 2 PCIE cables connected to GPU or for best performance 3 separate PCIE cables to GPU!
Don't go the easy way out.... get a stronger PSU and you will have no issues with randomly black screens.

UPDATE YOUR BIOS AND GRAPHICS CARD DRIVERS!!!
This is extremely important that you must implement new drivers if this is a big upgrade for you.
If you're not sure how Google the manufacture and find your motherboard model and find the support link.
Look for your model MOBO and download the latest bios firmware.
Graphics card drivers are online as well or run GeForce Experience software to update your system to the newest drivers!
Goodluck and have fun Gaming!!

Reviews.title: Works. Too hot. Overpriced.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 15, 2021
Reviews.text:
This is a 3080 Ti and so it behaves within the spec of a 3080 Ti. I have my unit de-shrouded and actively cooled by two Noctua A12x25 PWM 60.1 CFM 120mm fans (see pictures) at full load the GPU and the HotSpot temperatures are around 75C, which is perfectly acceptable. However the Memory Junction temperature commonly reaches 100C, and sometimes as high as 102C. (All of that given the ambient temperature of 25C.) This is bad despite being barely within spec. Apparently the thermal pads are sub-par as is common with MSI (and certain other AIB's) cards. I plan on replacing them once I can find the exact measurements on those.

Remember, de-shrouding your card, replacing the thermal pads, etc. DOES NOT void the warranty in the United States!

Overall I am satisfied with this video card, but that's because I don't mind tinkering with it to modify it as necessary and because I'm able to afford the absurdly high price. And make no mistake, this price is unequivocally obnoxious. I was able to get it at MSRP, which was $1,769.99 and after taxes my total was $1,923.98. Realistically, however, this card shouldn't cost more than $900 to $1000. Oh well, at least no scalper managed to benefit from my purchase.

P.S. - This GPU does fit within Cooler Master NR200. It can be put in as is if there are no fans on the bottom. Otherwise it will need to be de-shrouded. De-shrouding is recommended for better temperatures and lower noise levels. If you want to connect those bottom fans to the card so that it can manage them, you will need a connector such as this one: https://www.amazon.com/CRJ-Splitter-Adapter-Sleeved-Graphics/dp/B07T95C68T/

data.label: MSI Gaming GeForce RTX 3080 LHR 12GB GDRR6X 384-Bit HDMI/DP Nvlink Torx Fan 4 RGB Ampere Architecture OC Graphics Card (RTX 3080 Gaming Z Trio 12G LHR)
data.description: The GeForce RTX 3080 delivers the ultra performance that gamers crave, powered by Ampere—NVIDIA’s 2nd gen RTX architecture. It’s built with enhanced RT Cores and Tensor Cores, new streaming multiprocessors, and superfast G6X memory for an amazing gaming experience.

Reviews.title: A very good product, albeit with minor complaints.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 26, 2022
Reviews.text:
This is a very good card and at stock settings lines up nicely with all RTX 3080 benchmarks you can find online.

Its price is higher than average but this is largely due to the addition of RGB. If you're on a budget it's worth saving 100 dollars on a non-RGB card if you can and don't care about lighting effects.

Operating temperatures with my custom fan curve tend to be 45C at idle and 70C at full load with my modest overclock and no undervolting. This is very good for the power draw this card has, so it is a big plus.

This card seems to overclock well considering it can't be pushed past 102% power draw in MSI Afterburner. I'm able to have a stable +120 on the core and +600 on the memory, which isn't far off from what the cards that can do 115-120% power draw are able to hit. (Note: Please remember to consult guides and videos on overclocking before attempting to do so yourself.)

The card requires 3 8-pin connectors. A very large amount of power supplies, both OEM and aftermarket, do not have 3 of them by default (my Corsair RM850x for example only includes 2 8-pin cables), so if you have a modular PSU you'll want to buy an extra 8-pin PCIe cable that matches your power supply's manufacturer. Even though they often have multiple 8-pin connectors on one cable, you CAN NOT use the same cable for multiple slots. I recommend CableMod's cables as they're good quality and look pretty nice, albeit at a bit of a price premium. Just make 100% sure you buy the cable that matches your PSU. You can NOT use a cable intended for a Corsair power supply on a EVGA power supply or etc.

The fans have a minimum operating speed of 30%, meaning you can't turn them off for a 0-noise experience when the system is at idle or under very light loads. MSI Afterburner's override setting didn't change this. I'm not a maniac about the noise of my system and with it only 3 feet from my head I can't hear my PC at full load with headphones on while in-game, so this isn't an issue for me or most people.

All in all this is a very good RTX 3080 and I recommend it for anyone who feels it's time to upgrade. The 4000 series of GPU's is coming soon, but I'm willing to bet it will be months if not a full year before they're readily in-stock at anywhere near MSRP pricing given how rampant price gouging and scalping has become for PC components.

Reviews.title: Upgrade Enthusiasts May Want to Pull the Trigger
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 12, 2022
Reviews.text:
This review has been upgraded from a 4-star review to a 5-star review.

I have owned the MSI RTX 3080 for more than one month. The design is tasteful, and it comes with a support horizontal bracket. Performance in traditional game titles is excellent and reliable. Thermal outputs are shockingly low and fans perform quietly throughout. I am so impressed with MSI cooling technology and shroud design. Now that the VR stuttering problems have resolved, it is fair to recommend the RTX 3080 12G between $800-1000. I have extensively put all of my cards to task with Adobe Premiere Pro, Elden Ring, Cyberpunk 077, Halo 4, and Mech Warrior 5. Goodness! Graphics look gorgeous, and performance improvements are respectable compared to my GTX 1080 Ti. In short, the RTX 3080 12G units are worth every penny, and now they finally work in VR! At $850 for the MSI 12G is a no brainer! They deserve the highest recommendations.

P.S., MSRP has dropped to $799 for the 3080 12G version. This MSI card, the Aorus Master and the Asus cards being offered between $800-$850 hold my highest recommendations. I could not perceive any gaming performance differences between this version compared to the 3080 Ti nor the 3090 in 4K gaming. Hence, I strongly believe that 99% of gamers who operate at or under 4K and 120fps would NOT need anything above this level making the Nvidia RTX 4000 series and AMD RX 7000 series a moot purchase. With the latter offerings, consumers will have no choice but to upgrade the PC case with a strong airflow design and a new power supply unit (PSU) and the CPU and the motherboard as lower count CPU (fewer than 6 cores) may potentially throttle these cards. For many users, this essentially requires a new PC build.

Reviews.title: Be Careful
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2022
Reviews.text:
READ THE UPDATE!!

This is a good buy if you find it under $900. Solid performance, quiet when it isn’t stressed, good build quality. This thing is tough! My friend dropped it when I was building, and I had trouble getting my graphics card to appear in bios so I reslotted many times, screwed in and out, even almost ripped out the motherboard clamp when installing into a Msi motherboard (first build lol). Just shows MSI’s build quality. However, there were some corners cut in the rgb. Also the card is massive so make sure you get a big enough case and use the included riser so it doesn’t sag too much.

Pros:
Great performance ~ 140-190 fps in 1440p gaming
Build quality
It’s a graphics card at a reasonable price

Cons:
Rgb is horrid. The plastic cover over it is cloudy and when the rgb turns on the hot spots are clear as day.
Fans get super noisy under stress, I can hear it with a headset on.

Overall, if you find it at a good price, it’s one of the best 3080 cards with a high boost clock out the factory.

Update:
A month after using, my gpu died randomly. It was the same problem I was having when I first built it, the gpu was not recognized in device manager, nvidia, or in the bios. When it happened the first time, I thought it was my fault… but maybe it’s the Msi gpu or Msi motherboard. Horrible experience. I was just playing valorant with my friends and boom my two monitors say “No input signal”. This gpu was not stressed at all, valorant isn’t intensive even on the highway settings and my fps limit was 190, gpu usage while playing was 30-35%. There was no reason for it to overheat at temperatures were around 58 C. I have no idea what it is and I’m sending my pc to a repair shop to have them test out a different gpu in my system to see if it’s the motherboard or gpu. Even if it is the motherboard, horrible experience from Msi, I don’t know what to say. My integrated graphics on my i7-12700k works just fine and I will be using that until my new motherboard or gpu comes in, and I’m making sure to get asus products. Unbelievable and nightmare experience from a first time builder.

Another update: just filed an rma request for my 3080, return time is 15-30 business days… I don’t even know what to say, shipping is paid on my end too. So far the experience left me with 2 sleepless nights, carrying my heavy pc into my car (2 blocks away) down from the 9th floor of my apartment into a pc shop and back up, and 32$ shipping. The reason it’s 32$ is because when I first built the pc and the card didn’t work, I ordered another one from B&H as I was about to return my Amazon one since I thought it was broken and they made me pay shipping as well. The pc shop tested a different gpu and it worked fine, meaning it’s this card specifically. Good one MSI.

Final Update (hopefully): I just got my 3080 card back from the repair center, and it works! I can say the RMA service for Msi is okay. I had to call for my package to get scanned and actually worked on and then another to get an update on where my gpu is in the process. It spent a total of about 2 weeks at the center, and 10 days to ship back to me. It was a long process, but it worked. I also sent my gpu with the riser and original packaging and lost both. I got it sent back in a generic white package with padding, no riser or manuals came back to me. This could be my fault since I didn’t read everything on the RMA, but I just sent everything in case I get a replacement. Still annoying, but I’m happy my pc is finally running, if anything else happens I will be sure to update.

data.label: ASUS ROG Strix LC NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3090 Ti OC Edition Gaming Graphics Card (PCIe 4.0, 24GB GDDR6X, HDMI 2.1, DisplayPort 1.4a, Full-Coverage Cold Plate, 240mm Radiator, 600mm tubing, GPU Tweak)
data.description: The mind-blowing performance of the NVIDIA Ampere architecture just got cooler. The ROG Strix LC GeForce RTX™ 3090 Ti channels the power of liquid cooling to unlock the GPU’s full potential and then some, delivering ultra-quiet thermal performance that blows air-cooled designs out of the water.

Reviews.title: Beautiful card but be prepared for some custom modding if you want it to be silent
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 13, 2022
Reviews.text:
The good news. The Watercooler works, it cools down the GPU way below normal levels for this type of GPU.
Normal temperature for this GPU would be around 74-70 where this solution will lower it to 55-60 depending on your case configuration. The performance is also top notch, the GPU clock always stays at 2025Mhz and there is no need for OC as you will hardly get a single frame increase, not worth the hassle. Just so you have an idea, at 2070Mhz clock the most you could get is 1 FPS increase on Dying Light 2 (maxed out).

The default profile is more than enough. You could install GPU Tweak III if you want but it's not a solid software and it is buggy, also not needed.

Now the bad news. The fans provided by ASUS are clearly on the cheap side, noise as hell and insufficient for this type of All-in-One watercooler. Please remember that this poor unit with only 240mm 2 x 120mm FAN must absorb more than 400Watts of heat. Clearly it is not enough. I hate ASUS because of this, because they decided a 240mm radiator instead of a 360mm for compatibility reasons.

I've researched all the watercooled solutions and the block provided on this card along with the actual PCB were better than competing solutions so I paid the price for it and have to accept it's limitations. 240mm is not enough if you want the best heat dissipation.

Having said that, there is a way around it. Using a pair of Noctua's NF-12x25 PWM the noise can be mitigated big time. Those FAN's are clearly superior to the stock fans provided.

Now if you want to really push this card into low noise operations, you will need a 2 pair of Phanteks T30-120 in push-pull.

With that combination, you can set front fans to 1300RPM and back fans to 1000 RPM and have similar performance to the Noctuas at 2000RPM and almost the same heat disipation performance of the stock fans running at 2500 RPM but with a much lower noise level. With these FANs the product is in much better shape.

What you can't avoid here is the pump noise. It's high pitch and cannot be lowered. It is too bad that ASUS decided on such a noise pump. If you have a truly silent PC (like I have) you will hate it. So this is not a product designed for people that loves a completely dead silent PC.

Once you game, you will forget about the noise pump as it will produce less noise due to water heat and also FANs noise.

All in all a very good product. I won't do any 3090 Ti on air cooling as the hum from those tiny fans is intolerable and on watercooling solutions you can tweak your FANs to your heart's content.

Next product must have a 360mm radiator to be top performing, but I'm satisfied with this. Just know that the standard FANs provided are noise as hell and will need to be replaced if you want a more silent system.

Graphic Card Boards have started to come down in price finally. People buying them over the past months were paying as much as the whole computer should cost. Look through the Amazon listings - there are still a few scalpers looking for up to $6000 for something that should cost 25% of that.

This combination a 3090ti - the king of graphic boards - and a 240mm water cooler gives you the ultimate tools to overshadow almost any other unit, The cores, frames rates, and speed is just overwhelming. There is talk of the next generation of boards coming out next year but from what I have read, as of now, the 40XX series boards are only about 12% faster - something you really won't even notice. This is probably why people are grabbing these cards; since with that little upgrade there is no reason to wait. And who knows what prices they will be asking.

This board is a "beast" (said in a very good way) and it will do anything you may ask of it. We have both gamers and video/graphic editors using it and I have yet to hear a bad comment. If you want the best and fastest this is your board.

Reviews.title: Good upgrade from GTX 960 2GB!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on May 3, 2022
Reviews.text:
I had bought a GTX 960 2GB back in December of 2015. The card starting to show its age. After Amazon sent me a MSI GTX 1650 4GB GDDR6 when I originally purchased a MSI GTX 1650 Super 4GB GDDR6, I refunded the 1650, and I took the opportunity and went one step further to the EVGA GTX 1660 6GB GDDR5 Ultra SC. And I'm glad I did. Very good card for 1080p @ 60fps.

It's paired with my Ryzen 5 2600 (Stock), 16GB RAM (4GBx4) @ 2666Mhz, 2 SSDs, and one 2TB HDD. As a performance example, I can play Mass Effect Andromeda on Ultra Settings at 60fps, and when I disable V-Sync, the card throws out 75-80fps. I suspect it can run the latest games on High to Very High Settings at 1080p.

Great card if you're coming from a 900 series card. And with its 6GB of video memory, you'll be fine for the next few years... at 1080p.

Reviews.title: If you can get it for a reasonable price, a decent card, but at the current inflated prices...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 5, 2021
Reviews.text:
As far as video cards go, this one is pretty standard when it comes to installation, performance, and ascetics. You may run into some issues on smaller form-factor motherboards such as mATX. This card can extend over one of the very limited number of PCI-e slots, but the length of the card is definitely manageable (SC Ultra Gaming model). So far I've not had any issues with EVGA cards, so I can't comment about their customer support side, but the cards themselves seem to be very solid graphics cards.

As far as performance goes, if you're still on an older graphics card, 900 series and down, there's a noticeable performance bump. It's not exactly night and day depending on what you're upgrading from, but if your current video card bites the dust and you can't get a hold of the current 3000 series or even 2000 series, this one will get the job done.. IF.. you can find it for a reasonable price.

At the prices people are asking for this card right now, which can be double or triple the roughly $200 asking prices I was seeing in late 2020, to me at least, it's a hard sell at roughly ~$400 to ~$600 for a card that is already showing its age with current games. At current prices, in my humble opinion, the "value for the money" just isn't there, though my rating reflects the price of the card at the time I purchased it.

But, if you find yourself in a situation where you need a replacement card, amid all the price gouging going on, it's a decent card, just a VERY expensive one for what you do get at today's prices. Supply and demand I suppose.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 9, 2021

So, I've had this card a while now. I love how well it works and you get your moneys worth. Yes, there is that pause there waiting for a but, so here it is; But...It absolutely HATES windows 10. I've scoured for fixes, contacted NVIDA, contacted EVGA, contacted Microsoft, they each point me to the other and my issue seems to be a very common one but with a bit of a twist. The HDMI audio drops out and it changes my resolution size. Every. Single. Update. Windows 10 defender update? Drops it. Nvidia new driver update? Drop it. New driver for my mouse update? Drops it. And every single time I have to download and install the new update, reset the computer, do a clean install of the latest Nvidia driver and restart the computer again. Tried it on my friends computer with windows 8, no problem. Tried it on an older comp with windows 7, no problem. Put it back in mine...Windows defender update, audio dropped out...-.-

Don't get me wrong, I like the card, but it is extremely annoying sometimes...

Reviews.title: HD5770s and 6770s never came with 4GB of VRAM! AVOID!!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2022
Reviews.text:
The vast majority of HD6770s did not come with a VGA port. The real ones also require a 6-pin power connector. Most cards that have an output layout like this are fake and, seeing reviews from people saying it won't run DX11, I'm inclined to believe this isn't even a 6770 as those did run DX11. The listed clock speed is about 200mhz lower than the original cards which, at best, points to these being faulty cards flashed with a different BIOS to operate at a lower clock speed. HD 5770s and 6770s (same card with 2 names) also NEVER came with 4GB of VRAM.

Again, this points to this being a card with a fake BIOS. I've tested another faked GPU claiming to be a GTX 960 4GB and the card even reported itself as such to the computer. In actuality it was a GT640 with 1GB of VRAM. When a game would try to utilize the reported 4GB of VRAM that didn't exist, it would cause the computer to crash.

Best case scenario here, you get a GPU that was originally released in 2009 (as the 5770, again, identical to the 6770...AMD just renamed the same card 2 years later) which has not received driver support since 2015, running at 76% of it's original speed (which may be how it gets away without a 6 pin power connector...but I doubt it) and have to spend some time dialing in settings to avoid games using more than 1GB of VRAM so the computer won't crash. In other words KEEP SHOPPING!

Reviews.title: I NEEDED A CARD TO CRUISE AROUND THE INTERNET WITHOUT ISSUE AND THIS IS IT!
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 8, 2022
Reviews.text:
I just needed a basic video card to cruise around the internet without being stifled by lame performance of a cheap video card. While this card is a tad expensive it is not priced at the ridiculously insane prices of the middle to high end gaming video cards in 2022. This GPU has done the job of letting me go anywhere on the internet without video lag.

I had a more expensive NVIDIA GPU in my system with otherwise state of the art hardware. The newest most power Ryzen 9 \ 5900 CPU, fast memory and a 750 watt power supply. The NVIDIA GPU ran like hot garbage on my Ubuntu system. Ubuntu has a nasty sepia color scheme that saturates the entire OS and everything in it. It is not only ugly but painful to look at due to my vision issues.

I did not know for sure at the time but, I hoped a new video card from someone other than NVIDIA might perform better. Turns out this AMD designed GPU got rid of the nasty sepia tint. This video card creates a simple un-tinted OS that is a pleasure to use. The card is not BIG and uses only the power supplied by the GPU slot.

The card has some energy saver garbage installed that turns the card off if you power down your monitor. I took a star off for the energy saver mess. There really are no other issues. This is a great card to use on a Linux\Ubuntu system that is not used for hard core gaming.

Reviews.title: It does what I needed it to do
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 27, 2022
Reviews.text:
At my workplace I needed this half-height graphics card for a PC running a graphics intensive application that was practically unusable using the on-board graphics on the PC. Installing this card resolved the performance issues. I was pleased enough with that purchase that I bought one for my home computer to resolve some lag issues when playing 4K video on my old PC. This card resolved that issue, too. I don't know how this product benchmarks against the completion. I didn't do any testing like that. I simply had performance issues with applications that needed a graphics card performance boost. The price was right on this graphics card and I found that it worked fine to resolve those issues.

The only issue that I had was that the package came with no English instructions, no drivers and no software. I am an IT technician by trade, so I had little trouble finding the right drivers and software online. On one PC, Windows Update found the drivers, but I still had to download and install the correct version of the Radeon software. On the other PC I had to download both the drivers and software. So, this wasn't much of a problem for me, but it may be more than a novice PC users can deal with.

This product did what I needed and I've had no problems with it either at home or at work. It gets a 5 star rating from me even though I would have expected better instructions for installing the product and obtaining the correct drivers & software.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on August 29, 2022
Reviews.text:
Diese Grafikkarte ist absolout NICHT VR fähig ! Wer VR möchte MUSS mehr investieren !

Dennoch möchte ich diese Grafikkarte einmal für ihre erstaunliche und herausragende Leistung loben.
Hier hat MAXSUN alles richtig gemacht!

Ich habe einen Rechner mit ordentlich Leistung und natürlich auch mit einer entsprechenden Grafikkarte um damit die Valve Index VR-Brille zu betreiben. Ich bekam ein ausrangiertes Fujitsu Esprimo C710 mit USB3.0 und einem betagten aber ausreichenden Prozessor und suchte nun nach einer Low Profile Grafikkarte, die dabei auch noch schlank und bestmögliche Leistung bringen sollte.

Mein verrückter Plan:
Wenn an meinem Rechner was abraucht, sollte der kleine Esprimo das Ganze überbrücken.
Mit 32GB RAM und der MAXSUN Radeon RX 550 ist mir das sehr gut gelungen.
Wir reden hier natürlich von minimalistischen Grafikeinstellungen ABER BeatSaber, Phasmophobia (SinglePlayer), Pistol Whip und Blade & Sorcery sind durchaus spielbar und die Karte wird dabei nicht übermäßig heiß. Half Life - Alyx hingegen lagt sehr deutlich (wie es auch zu erwarten ist)

Dies ist keine Kaufempfehlung für VR, es soll aber verdeutlichen, was die kleine Karte auf dem Kasten hat.
Denn hier schlägt sie die vergleichbare GT 1030 um längen. Für Titel wie Diablo III und Co ifinde ich die RX 550 völlig in Ordnung und sie macht dort auch eine echt gute Figur.

Fazit: Es gibt natürlich deutlich stärkere Grafikkarten, egal ob AMD oder NVIDIA aber wer bei dem aktuellen Auf und Ab der Grafikkartenpreise eine günstige und verhältnismäßig starke Grafikkarte sucht, weil er sich gerade keine große leisten kann oder wie bei mir für einen kleineren Zweitrechner, sollte hier gut bedient sein.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in Germany on September 7, 2022
Reviews.text:
Hab wirklich lange und intensiv nach einer neuen, bezahlbaren und vom Preis nicht so abgehobenen Grafikkarte gesucht. Hier passt das Preis/Leistungsverhältnis für mich gerade noch so. Wir zocken wenig wenn dann Strategiespiele, Autorennen usw eine unserer Anforderungen war die Grafik entscheidend zu verbessern ohne Unmengen Geld zu investieren. Also neuer Monitor, Grafikkarte und ein zusätzlicher Speicherblock. Das Ergebnis kann sich mehr als sehen lassen!!!
Kein geruckel mehr und eine schön saubere Grafik, das beste die Grafikkarte wird bei uns nicht mal warm, läuft also alles sauber. Für 160€ kann man bei der Karte nichts verkehrt machen!

Reviews.title: It Works...
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2022
Reviews.text:
OK, it arrived on time, but that is sort of an issue. When I purchased this product, Amazon guaranteed delivery on Sunday Feb. 6, 2022. On the 6th, I woke up to an email that it would be delayed until Monday the 7th. No problem, we had a blizzard and people have been digging out. BUT, it was delivered on Sunday and just left outside, in the freezing cold and snow, without me knowing or expecting it was going to happen. Luckily, a friend stopped in for five minutes, and by coincidence that's when the package was left in the cold and snow, so it wasn't there when he came up the porch, but it was there when he went down and my package got to me safely. The seller bears no responsibility for this, as it was fulfilled by Amazon, but for some reason, Amazon doesn't let us write reviews for the customer service, so here it is. You can do better, Amazon.

As for the product itself, it's not really as bad as my "stars" would suggest. It arrived in what appears to be brand new packaging. I can't find any evidence that the anti-static bag was ever opened before. I installed it in my aging Dell Inspiron 3700 (with an i5-8400, and 12GB of RAM) hooked it all up, turned it on, and after about 5 minutes of some installation process (at which time there WAS video) my screen automatically reverted to the display settings it had prior to the install, and it works just fine. I installed Nvidia GeForce and, after one more driver update it was over. The entire process was from start to finish was less than 20 minutes.

This was the first time I have ever installed a GPU, and I can only assume that that is EXACTLY how it is supposed to work. As for the value for money, NO GPU has a good value to money ratio. Crypto-miners and the pandemic have seen to that.

As for gaming, this just is NOT a card built to plays today's most advanced games. I got this card because PGA 2K21 can only track one profile at a time, so two people with two profiles need two copies of the game to track their stats in co-op. Now, my aging Dell could manage about 25 FPS in "potato mode," a number that made it unplayable. With this card, on low settings (one step up from potato mode), this card and the i5 deliver 90FPS steadily at 1080p quality.

The problem there, is that 2K21 is really "The Golf Club 3" with 2K's marketing slapped on the box. As such, the entire install from Steam was just 6.6GB. And as every modern gamer knows, the 5-15GB game file size was lost to any game above the 'indie" classification when the games went 4K. Which means that the game would have to still be in potato mode if 4K textures even existed in the files for processing.

The only other "modern" game I have on the Dell is Kerbal Space Program. And that, with low settings turned on, and the FPS locked to 80, this card and the i5 can get maintain a steady 60 in the assembly buildings and launchpad, and dropped into the 40 FPS range during the launches I tested. But that is normal. KSP can make even monster PC's cry for mercy if the user launches a big enough ship. The limitation there is far more CPU dependent than GPU dependent as the game tries to simulate physics, heat, and gravity calculations on hundreds of individual parts simultaneously.

As for video streaming, honestly, I don't see very much improvement over the streaming quality of just the i5, but there is no LESS quality to the streaming, and that's what matters. My monitor is a 32" 1440p, with a 144 Hz refresh rate.

I do, however, have a couple of issues with this card. On the product description page, there is clearly a picture of the various output I expected to find on this card. And if I remember right that picture had a display port, an HDMI port, a 24 pin DVI port, and a VGA port (I might be wrong about the VGA port). The card that arrived at my house, does NOT have either a VGA port or a display port. So, if your monitor has either of those, BUYER BEWARE!!! I was only ever going to use the HDMI port, so I'm not too fussed.

My bigger issue is the plastic shroud on the GPU itself. The card doesn't cover the same amount of area that the plastic shroud does, so I have several square inches of exposed plastic shroud inside my PC, acting as a "bowl" to catch any dust flying around. And while the Dell has a paper filter the covers the main air intake, and a sort of cone directing the CPU exhaust directly out into the room and that has kept the amount of dust inside my case to a minimum. But now there is the GPU fan sourcing air from an unfiltered area, and just exhausting the air inside the case. So, ALL bets are off as to how this plays out in the remaining life left in my aging Dell.

That is just BAD design all the way around. It uses more material than is strictly needed meaning the manufacturer is paying more than is strictly necessary for each card manufactured, and it CAN'T be good for the PC to have an actual dust catcher inside a machine that you work hard to keep dust free. And I can PROMISE the manufacturer, that if my aging Dell suddenly dies six weeks from now, I know EXACTLY who I will blame. I won't get a refund, but THEY won't get a return customer.

And for that reason, ultimately, I will give this GPU a 3-star rating with a serious "BUYER BEWARE" due to the misleading product photos, as well as the poorly designed fan shroud.

Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2021

Reviews.title: High performance, low noise, takes up a LOT of room
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2022
Reviews.text:
I have an enormous Corsair case. I was briefly worried this card wouldn't clear the hard drive trays. Turns out it has just enough clearance. But this thing is huge. I bought without checking measurements because my case really is huge, but that may not have been a great move. My advice is: check.
I didn't really need a new card for the performance. My 1080 Ti never struggled with any game playing max settings in 4K. However, it had a problem that caused it to crash my computer once per day. I got tired of troubleshooting and just bought a new card. Does it really make a difference for me? Well, I'm still playing at max settings in 4K, so no. That said, my benchmarks scored much higher, so I expect this will carry me years longer than the old card. And you can't beat this price for a 3080. The anti-bitcoin mining feature doesn't hurt gaming performance any.
I was worried something was wrong when I installed it. The fans didn't turn on. I thought perhaps my power supply wasn't giving it enough juice. Nope. That's a noise-saving feature. It can passively cool unless brought under significant load. The fans will turn on, all three of them, and they do great work. My card temperature is now lower than my CPU temperature while gaming, even though the card is being worked harder. The fans work in alternate directions, so that the middle fan helps both the left and right fans. I'm not sure it's not a gimmick, but given the cool temperatures I'm inclined to think it works.

Reviews.title: Best value at MSRP, 4K gaming beast
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 5, 2022
Reviews.text:
This card, even while being 2 years old, is still very good value today when bought at or close to MSRP. It offers 4K gaming experience with ray tracing and DLSS, and 10GB VRAM is decent for ultra level gaming. I bought it to do machine learning with it, so 10GB is a bit stretch. Still, no complaints for the value you get. Card is quiet, fans only spin when under load.

Included are the size comparisons of Gigabyte Gaming OC RTX 3080 10GB vs RTX 1660 6GB vs AirPods. It's a very large card. Very thick (2.5 slots), and very long. I barely fit this card into my ATX midtower (see photo). If you only use air cooling like me, you should be fine. But if you use liquid cooling and radiators, then be sure to measure the dimensions so it can actually fit.

Also, card is extremely heavy. Highly recommend to buy a GPU support so it doesn't sag too much.

You can also mine Ethereum or other coins with it. LHR means nothing since mining pools can unlock the hash rate limiter now.

Power consumption wise, when idle it consumes 40W. It can go all the way up to 370W max. Be sure your PSU is at least 750W for this card.

A very top of the line card to keep you entertained while waiting for the RTX 40 series. Also 4 year warranty is a nice plus. Be sure to register card on Gigabyte Aorus.

Reviews.title: Review After 1 Week of Usage
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2022
Reviews.text:
I initially reviewed this card as an unstable card which should be avoided, but after 2 replacements, the card does seem to run without noticeable crashes. However, the unit I got performs worse than the previous units, scoring only 17300 for Timespy when previous units scored 17600~17800 (stock setting GPU with stock setting 12700k).

I'm using Lian-Li O11 Dynamic Evo with 2 corsair ml 120 fans (75CFM max) pointed directly to the graphics card , and it runs about 46~49C at idle, 66~68C at high/full load. The temps does hit 70C if room temp is high or during a 30min~1hr furmark.

Since this card is the cheapest available rtx 3080, I'd say go for it if you're tight on budget. However, be aware that quality control issues exist, so you may have to go through painstaking replacement processes like I did. If you have a bit of extra to spend, I'd suggest going for more stable and reputable cards like Asus TUF or EVGA FTW3

Reviews.title: Noisy Fan
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on October 8, 2022
Reviews.text:
This card was an unexpected buy, and replaced a 2070 I had for a few years. Seems to perform within margin across multiple games and benchmarking tools. No complaints there for sure.

My problem with this card is ENTIRELY with the fans.
-At idle, it's totally silent inside my nzxt h510i case (a tighter fit than I'd hoped)
-At 50% fan speed you can already hear it whirring just slightly. Nothing annoying, and easily drowned out by playing any video, music, or game.
-At 60% fan speed it's a little bit louder but still totally negligible
-At 70% it's whirring and humming, and a bit more noticeable
-At 80% The humming is quite pronounced and can be heard during games.
-At 100% It's almost like an aircraft engine starting up, and it creates the most HORRID buzzing sound I've heard in my entire life.

Granted it rarely (if ever) forces itself to 100%. But with that noise and open-back headphones, I'm doomed to listen to it forever. If this won't end up being an issue for you then not a bad buy by any means.

Reviews.title: Though I begrudgingly spent the money, I'm (mostly) happy I did
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2021
Reviews.text:
First thing's first: the price. I paid about $1400 for this, and that was probably as cheap as I could reliably find it on the internet. There are some sketchy sites promising more normal prices, but there's no way those sites are clean. I tried NewEgg first, and while I found one for a few hundred dollars cheaper, my card kept getting declined (no idea why, I used it for this purchase and it went through the first time). In short, don't expect to find this (or any RTX cards) below $1k anytime soon. And if you do, be SUPER wary of any site that has them.

The card itself is amazing. I went from a GTX 1080 TI, which was already a beefy card. This, however, is slightly bigger still. It's probably 2 inches longer, and maybe 1/2 to 3/4 inches wider. I thought there would be some fitting issues in my NZXT 510 case, but it sat in pretty comfortably. The only issue was somehow, even after screwing everything in, there was no signal going to my monitor. It took removing and reseating it for it to finally be recognized. Not sure if that's common, but it happened, so take that for what it's worth.

The rest of my system is an i7 and 32gb of RAM. The first thing I did was run Red Dead Redemption on ultra and do a benchmark. Lowest FPS was 30, highest was mid-80's (IIRC). I also do a lot of flying in DCS, and cranked that up to max as well. The end results were a noticeable increase in quality, as well as a decrease in sound (at least it seems like this card is more quiet than my 1080 TI).

All in all, aside from some standard price gouging (that I absolutely expect across all platforms selling these), this card is amazing and delivers on all fronts. I was a little leery on buying from a third party on Amazon, especially giving the price and what I was buying, but XOTIC PC delivered on all fronts. It arrived almost a week early, though the box was a bit wore (I suspect it was just a previously used box they are repurposing), the card box itself looked as though it came right off the shelf.

I would absolutely recommend this purchase from this company to anyone in the market.

It wasn't until I put my old gpu back in that everything ran well again. If this issue did not arise to begin with it would be a fantastic purchase, the thing ran very well and didn't get too hot even for a mediocre airflow case. It also didn't have any trouble on loading and rendering, was very efficient in that department.

it is really long card, I was unable to fit it on Mid Tower Case.

Reviews.title: good
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2022
Reviews.text:
pros
high end /cheapest 3080 12 gb

Next i don't to get you down go for it if this is what you want but i'm going to ultimately review this card, nvidia and pc gaming in general post mining. I feel i need to do this because i'm not just reviewing this card as a 3080, but really as a gaming tool. I actually really am writing this cause i want to help. this is a lot of money and i really have a lot of concerns after trying this.

- its' hot, the memory is especially hot you can undervolt and do all this stuff to fix it. but kind of lame for the cost. I mean fine i'm a cs major i can do it, but it 's a hassle and it's a compromise on a high end card that costs a ton of money.

The card:
I'm going to be honest here. compared to a 1080ti (i had paid 400 for this) or rx 480 (200) yeah sure it's faster it's not that big of a deal. Most games are written for consoles.

Let me give you the 1080 ti as an example cyberpunk. 2k monitor 60hz. You will be hard pressed to tell the difference. With fsr you can utterly max out this game and on my 1080ti. On the 1080 ti i'm getting 75f (23 c)temps to maybe 119f , yes F!!!. I put in the 3080 the card is running at 80c. I mean freaking insane. that's c vs f there. Not a mistake. Granted the 1080ti is an evga, and this is a "cheaper" msi card, but the evga 1080 ti cost me 400 new years ago. now with FSR and soon fsr2 i dont' see the point. I though ray tracing would be cool. to me it's not. Actually i dont' care at all. It doesn't make much difference to the game ok for me none. So here we go why is this a remotely compelling product. It doesn't really do anything new, it's runs way too hot, and it's at the EOL with nvidia's business model. They'll jsut stop supporting it. I think this is a very fair comparison. It's a card for 5 years ago that was half the cost new, and a level up and competes very favorably in a lot of ways.

-- This 3080 thing is huge too costly, and overly marked up even after mining. I mean it's hot as hell. You can undervolt and do all this crap to fix it, but man why am i doing that? It sounds like a jet. I'm using a half x 932 advanced case with insane level of fans. W/o tweaks i'm getting 80c + here.

AMD Vs Nvidia.
AMd is now supporting nvidia hardware better than nvidia fsr /fsr2. Think about this. Now i finally get it for me this really comes back to raytracing. it's pretty pointless. I used to use brick and mortar stores to try stuff. Note i LOVE amazon. they are great, but i'd have loved to had seen this card before i bought it. You really cant' tell form youtube. I dont' see anything compelling here for the money. I waited 2 years to pay 800 for a overly hot video card. I mean sure if this were 5-600 it might be ok. but 800 why? OK maybe you are a 4k gamer and want 120 hz refresh. this might be for you. I don't' see that taking off any time soon with these prices. Look 1060 is still the biggest card on steam for a reason. These are the smart folks if you ask me. i would just get an amd card where they put all the performance toward rasterization, or wait for cards to continue to fall back in prices to where they should be, or get a consoles. there are a ton of options that seem better to me personally. I'm not even anti nvidia, i think amd cards are too costly too. I just think these are even more too costly. Xbox hands down is better deal until these guys adust.

Power usage is really high already. I mean the 1080 ti is silent no heat and my computer works much better. and yes i have an very high airflow case with a side panel. Same case same spot my 1080ti is running 90f (Ferinheight) vs the 3080 at 86 c (i was hitting). are you kidding me. I wonder what would happen if i just overclocked my 1080ti to the point it got that hot if there would even be a difference.

Vs consoles:

here's the reality. i can get a series x right now on the msft store it's easy probably even on amazon. completely cant' tell the difference sure on paper this is faster, but i've been down this road before. They optimize the console it close the gap at least a tier higher like 3070 level. I mean that why this card was suppose to be 600 in the first place. It's always been about flexibility on pc, yes i like mods, i like the online experience it's great, i like a little extra effects, but seriously i can get a console for half this price easy, and the deal is with the optimizations on that hardware, and trust me it's no joke, it's very close. People talk about tflops and such. Sure it's a little better 1/3 pretty close toa 6700xt actually, but in reality when you have the memory so close to the gpu and cpu and all the crazy optimizations it's close to a 3070 minimum over time. It's the truth. Games are cheaper on xbox too you can get used. it's just a better experience in a lot of ways. Yeah i wanted to pc game but these companies are so out of touch. They aren't living up to the expectations. Mining is really stupid, just in so many ways, but but where ti's impacted me is the gpu greed has run these prices up to insane levels. For nothing. This was such a let down. I'll take xbox over this at these prices even still. I'd really have to think if it was 600. wtih my xbox i'm getting a 3700 cpu, 6700xt gpu and 16gb of ddr6 ram totally focused to gaming, and full attention of devs. This card really should be 500 at this point. They have a ton of supply, it's on a cheap node, and it's a hassle because the cooling and power draw sucks.

This card was suppose to be 600 2 years ago, it's 800 now. I 'm just honestly not satisfied. Go ahead and buy it, but i'm telling you i was disappointed but hey that's me.

These costs are out of control. Compared to the series x i really dont' think ti's all that much better in say cyberpunk wither 3 or any of the games i play. In fact other than load times i dont' think anyone is too worried about cutting edge hardware after 2 years of nobody being able to get it other than for generating fake money.

This is my opinion,

Ray tracing is insanely overblown. I saw flashes of light. who cares?

Nvidia stuff in general: with fsr /fsr2 coming i'm able to get pretty great performance out of much cheaper hardware i don't need dlss. makes me really question nvidia. i think i'm switching to amd they support old stuff better, and finally their drivers are good anyway now. Yes they sucked before which is why i had left the rx 480 in 1017 for the 1080ti evga for 400 new.

This card specifically: This thing is huge too costly, and overly marked up even after mining. These should be like 600 at best. I say screw tsmc too. Raising prices I'd rather just have a cheaper node with new features and slightly less fast. These guys just don't' get it. I mean it's hot as hell. You can undervolt and do all this crap to fix it, but man why am i doing that? It sounds like a jet.

PC gaming Don't' know guys i'm really starting to question pc gaming. It was always more but even after mining these prices aren't adjusting fast enough for me. I think i'm going to skip next generation too see if it's just me. IF it is i'll stick with consoles or go do something else. If their market share starts to shrink then maybe i'll consider it. This chip shortage stuff has been going on for several years now. Right it's nto just gaming. but hey Sony and Microsoft aren't stupid enough to pay these prices so why should i be. Eventually they have to fix this. Cause other things like computers for work need this stuff too. Maybe it takes a couple more years, possibly not buying this will motivate them, or maybe it won't. The way i see this is total profit = sales * profit. I think think there is an over emphasis on profit and not on sales number go look at the steam hardware survey.

Ultimately i didn't have any more fun on this than i did on my pascal card. I think i'm going to jump ship on nvidia and switch to amd next, and or sit on my console another generation and re assess if and when prices come down. Pc gaming has just gotten too expensive, too hot, and too much dramma. I ultimately didn't have much fun dealing with all this, and really just fretted about the money and temps, voltage etc. With my console, or older card i just enjoyed it. Nvidia and really to some extent amd, and these manufactures or whatever we call them have removed all the fun from pc gaming for me. It's horrible taste in my mouth and i really hated this product when i factored in the cost. Form what i'm hearing of the new ones they are just getting hotter and need like a kilowatt. hell i'd take a 4060-70 for a few hundred if we can do that. It's probably close to this. So i say whats the rush here. Console is the play at this point in time.

IN conclusion if i'm a game developer will i write games for 800 dollar gpus, of course not, and it shows. I mean your lucky to get support for a 400 gpu. yeah it used to be premium you can get more smoke and cool effects for a couple hundred, which is why i have the 1080ti, id' bite but this is 2x the cost vs the xbox, and it's not 2x better. It's like 10% better MAX. The only way you'll ever see the features of this card full utilized is if nvidia goes in and writes all the games or you really desire super high frame rate. I guess i just dont' care.

here's the fix: sell this card for 500. that would be worth it and actually have some value. Just stay on the cheaper node, and optimize power usage by adding more chip l2 /l3 cache, and using slower ram. Forget about this insanley trillion dollar fab cutting edge stuff. That's a product i'd actually like to buy. the more i hear the less excited i am for the future. I think after using this that's the product i'm looking for. I make good money, i like gaming but i'd also like to retire someday. Is this too much to ask?

Reviews.title: Undervolt
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2022
Reviews.text:
Good card gonna last probably for the next 5 generations until rtx 8000 series will show up or something similar. Swapped my old gtx 1070 for rtx 3800 12gb. It draws twice as much power.
With the right under volting you can gain about 3% extra boost at 347W.
My old gtx 1070 took about 170W max at full load. When I set my 3080 to draw max 170W it’s around 59% faster than 1070 and also way cooler temps.
When I let the card go loose taking 350W it’s about 248% faster than my old gtx 1070

For flat screen gaming at 1080p 1070 is enough. If you want to experience some good VR gaming at 4K then this card scratch that itch.

Reviews.title: Excellent FS2020 GPU
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on August 11, 2022
Reviews.text:
Fantastic card which, coupled with modern system, will deliver excellent performance.

I matched this with the following new build, and with Flight Simulator 2020 in mind.

*i5 12400
*MSI MAG B660 WiFi DDR4
*Noctua SE-224-XT Air Cooler (excellent value)
*1TB Samsung 980 Pro M.2 (excellent value on sale $125 -- 6900 MB/s read, 5200 MB/s write)
*4x8GB Corsair Vengeance (DDR2133/3200)
*MSI A650GF Modular PSU

This card is not a Porsche that will win the race, but more a Cadillac with a big purring V8. A powerful cruiser, getting you where you're going (good gaming/sim experience), comfortably and in style.

FS2020 scanned system and recommended Ultra settings. Lowest were 30fps in super high density areas (JFK, Heathrow, Haneda, etc.). After BIOS update which allowed XMP profile and memory running at 3200, lowest is 40 fps in same areas and up from there. No problem getting 60 pfs everywhere else, everything stock. May tweak it all someday but just enjoying as it is for now. Smooth as glass.

I don't do the shoot 'em up games, but I looked at plenty of reviews and videos comparing this card to 3060 Ti, 3070, and 3080. It has compelling performance against those with FS and many other games, Cyberpunk, for example, and especially with the prices involved. Whether you'll actually notice or need 145 vs 125 fps I guess is up to you. Not so much in FS and this card has extra VRAM which will come in handy with 1440 ultra wide displays :)

The three fans are high quality, and it runs very cool and quiet, assuming decent airflow and cable management in the case. This card should last a very long time running it at stock.

$400-450, about the best you can get now with the GPU craziness. Nvidia due to release their 4000 series soon though, so probably good for a c-note discount if you can wait until then.

Reviews.title: Very bad performance for the price.
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2022
Reviews.text:
This RTX 3080 TI VENTUS has a very bad performance or they send me a defective one.

08-02-2022: After contacting and writing emails back and forth with the seller EXCaliberPC the tech support didn’t help me much to solve the issue and they end up with the 30 days return policy in a looping thing, so I took the RTX 3080 TI card to an electronic shop, the technician told me the problem is on the Thermal Pads on the VRAM and Thermal Paste on the GPU, because the year(s) of use the PADS/Thermal Paste become hard in a way that don’t dissipate much heat and the RTX internal thermal switch trip and shut down the GPU cores. He charged me $300.00 (parts $70.00 Thermalright Thermal Pad 12.8 W/mK, 120x120x3mm and Thermal Grizzly Kryonaut Extreme ) to replace the PADS and the PASTE and is working now like a champ.
Now I actually paid with the repair cost $1,300.00 and too much of my time to solving this issue. Next time I’m not going to buy products that come from EXCaliberPC, I think is a rip-off. The top price for this type of bad/used card should be $450.00.

Reviews.title: Great Value for its price, but it's extremely noisy when fans are over 80%
Reviews.location-date: Reviewed in the United States on March 25, 2022
Reviews.text: This GPU has a lot of flaws like many of you know, but for its value under $300 is quite good. I managed to fully overclock this card to its topmost limit and its completely stable and cool, but since the fans ramp up quite aggressively you MUST modify the fan curve so that it never gets over 80%. With fans at 80% the GPU reaches 60C and the Hotspot reached 85C which is extremely cool for its specs. With this card I can play Cyberpunk 2077 1080p at medium setting at 60 fps with a slight tweak to the settings and Forza Horizon 5 1080p at High settings at over 60 fps. The biggest advice or new owners is: NEVER ENABLE RAY TRACING, this card will not be able to play even minecraft at 720p on the lowest setting with ray tracing enabled. This card will be useful for around 2 more years so take that in mind when purchasing it, truthfully, I wanted an RX 6600 XT but my previous GPU died and needed a decent replacement quickly.
